parameter 1: The original version of Animalympics was separated neatly into Summer and Winter Games halves. The version seen on TV and on video is the re-edited version, which most likely was created for its debut on HBO in the 80's. The version currently being shown on the Disney Channel has several edits: - A good deal of the "Noah's Ark Disco" sequence was cut (anything with animals smoking, drinking, and carousing) - Dean Wilson (the otter) saying of Kit Mambo and Rene, "Hey man, they're goin' all the way!" was cut. - Several other minor edits of topical 70's jokes were cut.
parameter 2: The original version of Animalympics was separated neatly into Summer and Winter Games halves. The version seen on TV and on video is the re-edited version, which most likely was created for its debut on HBO in the 80's. The version currently being shown on the Disney Channel has several edits: - A good deal of the "Noah's Ark Disco" sequence was cut (anything with animals smoking, drinking, and carousing) - Dean Wilson (the otter) saying of Kit Mambo and Rene, "Hey man, they're goin' all the way!" was cut. - Several other minor edits of topical 70's jokes were cut.
parameter 3: An R-rated and a more explicit unrated version exists.
parameter 4: Released as part of the GoreZone Movie Massacre series with a censored logo appearing over all male nudity
parameter 5: Television versions aired on TNT and TBS delete, among others: - The scenes where Jennings and the students smoke pot. The scene is cut just after Jennings locks the door and smiles. - After Clorette DePasto falls over and reveals the tissue paper in her bra, the entire scene, with the angel, the devil, and the shots of half naked Clorette on the bed are cut out. It immediately jumps to her being ridden home in the shopping cart.
parameter 6: NBC edited 13 minutes from this film for its 1981 network television premiere.
parameter 7: Released as part of the GoreZone Movie Massacre series with a censored logo appearing over all male nudity
parameter 8: There is a version of "Animal House", which contains an alternate soundtrack, wherein the background music is mostly 80s rock music. This is especially clear in the cafeteria scene, where the lack of "don't know much about history" is evident (and catastrophic). This version has been aired at least once in Danish television.

parameter 46: Two versions of this film exist: this English-language version was directed by Clarence Brown, while a simultaneously filmed German-language version was directed by Jacques Feyder.  The German version has a different running time and features a different supporting cast.
